h1_38: University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center Program
h3_39: University of Oklahoma College of Medicine
span_48: University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center
p_64: Dashes ("-") indicate data for a particular field are not provided for this program in Residency Explorer. Reasons why data are not being provided can vary (e.g., they are not reported or available, they are not applicable, or they are based on an insufficient number of people for reporting purposes).
h3_68: # of Filled Resident Positions, by Year*

th_97: # of Residents Who Were Graduates of a Joint MD-PhD program
p_100: In-house dermatopathology rotation. Residents have the ability to attend AAD conference and present at scientific meetings. Hands-on training of Mohs/dermatologic surgery and cosmetics. Weekly grand rounds speaker series, Morphologic Conference with patient viewing and M&M Conferences on an alternating basis. Educational allowance as funds available. Resident well-being activities. Pediatric dermatology exposure. Skin of Color clinic and Complex Derm clinic exposure.
